title: Citibank Korea Launches Citigold Private Client, a Wealth Management Service for High Net-Worth Individuals (HNWIs)
summary: Seoul - Citibank Korea opened its first Citigold Private Client Center on the 12th floor of Gangnam Finance Center August 17, 2012. Senior management from regional and local offices, including Jonathan Larsen, Global Retail Banking Head; YK Ha, Citibank Korea Chief Executive; and Paul Hodes, Asia Pacific Consumer Bank Wealth Management Head, joined Citi employees and clients to celebrate the center's opening.
tag-1: Citibank Korea Launches Citigold Private Client, a Wealth Management Service for High Net-Worth Individuals (HNWIs)
tag-3: Seoul – Citibank Korea opened its first Citigold Private Client Center on the 12th floor of Gangnam Finance Center August 17, 2012. Senior management from regional and local offices, including Jonathan Larsen, Global Retail Banking Head; YK Ha, Citibank Korea Chief Executive; and Paul Hodes, Asia Pacific Consumer Bank Wealth Management Head, joined Citi employees and clients to celebrate the center's opening.
tag-4: Citigold Private Client targets top-tier clients with a minimum total balance of 1 billion KRW of which at least 500 million KRW are in investment assets. These are clients who would benefit from more professional investment advice than others as Citi aims to provide unique and differentiated products backed up by research from top-class private bankers.
tag-5: Citigold Private Client clients will receive personalized wealth management services from experienced and capable private bankers selected using a strict evaluation process. These private bankers have at least 10 years of experience in wealth management and an average of 15 years experience in the financial industry. Citi constantly trains private bankers to enhance their knowledge and extend better service to clients.
tag-6: Each private banker will handle only a small number of clients to enable him or her to pay close attention in tailoring services to suit individual clients. A dedicated team of experts including portfolio and insurance counselors together with experts in investments, research, tax, legal matters and real estate will support these private bankers to meet clients' sophisticated needs.
tag-7: Citigold Private Client will provide customers access to a number of exclusive investment options and services. As the industry leader in structured products, Citi will continually provide diversified structured products to clients. The bank's daily pick of 500 bonds will also give clients a new range of investment options. For those who invest in assets overseas, Citigold Private Client offers FX Forward to manage currency risks. Clients also enjoy access to exclusive research from Citi's Global Research consisting of 446 analysts in 70 countries worldwide.
tag-8: Since children's education is a key area of interest for HNWI clients, Citigold Private Client offers training courses for scions as well as legacy-planning advice. Scions are exclusively invited to local and overseas financial training programs specifically drawn up for the purpose of educating them. Other privileges include access to Citi's global banking services. Citigold Private Client customers can access centers worldwide while easily opening accounts and applying for credit cards. In the event of an emergency, these clients are entitled to an emergency cash service of up to $10,000.
tag-9: YK Ha, CEO of Citibank Korea, said "Citibank first introduced wealth management services in Korea with 'Citigold' in 1991 for customers with 100 million KRW. Since then, 21 years have passed, and the HNWI market has grown significantly. Going through the financial crisis, HNWIs have developed the need for the sophisticated financial services. Citibank is introducing Citigold Private Client to meet this market demand and will provide enhanced professional wealth management services. As Citibank Korea has been selected best private bank in Korea by Asiamoney for three years consecutively, we have proven our specialty in wealth management services. I believe we can now provide private banking know-how to more clients by introducing Citigold Private Client."
tag-10: Citigold Private Client will run series of investment seminars inviting key speakers from global financial markets starting with a session with Mark Mobius on August 21, 2012. Additionally, weekly and monthly seminars with CIOs are scheduled going forward. Clients can also engage in one-on-one meetings with an investment committee panel consisting of 20 CIOs from renowned asset management companies in Korea.
tag-11: The Citigold Private Client center at Gangnam is its flagship branch in Korea. Citibank has placed private bankers in several other branches with plans on expanding the number of Citigold Private Client centers.
tag-12: Citibank Korea Inc. Citibank had opened its first branch in Korea in 1967, and was born newly as Citibank Korea Inc. (CKI) through integration with KorAm Bank in 2004. CKI serves customers at 220 branches (as of end of March 2012) in Korea by providing the first class financial products and services based on the various products and know-how of Citi with global network including 200 years of history and 200 million customers in more than 160 countries. CKI delivers new financial world to the customers through development of innovative financial products and services, encompassing from corporate and investment banking to consumer banking, private banking, and wealth management. Furthermore, Citibank Korea Inc., as a responsible corporate citizen, conducts diverse community activities in the areas of financial education, next generation education, woman, diversity, community, and environment consistently in corporation with sound non-profit organizations.
tag-13: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
